alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Douglas, east central Park and southwestern Jefferson Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 159 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 6 miles south of Shawnee to near Westcreek, or along a line extending from 86 miles southwest of Greeley to 28 miles northwest of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo Creek, Devil`s Head, Wellington Lake, Pine Grove, Cheesman Reservoir, Deckers and Perry Park. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
